title: 115_hr2555
content: The "Veterans' Health Care Integrity Act of 2017" requires compliance of medical facilities with scheduling appointments for hospital care and medical services. The "Veterans' Health Care Integrity Act of 2017" mandates annual certification by the director of each VA medical facility to ensure compliance with scheduling regulations and accurate wait time data submission. The Secretary cannot waive any regulations for a facility. The director of a VA medical facility must annually certify compliance with regulations. If certification is not made, a report must be submitted explaining the noncompliance and actions being taken. No bonuses can be received by certain officials if certification is not made. The director of a VA medical facility must annually certify compliance with regulations. If certification is not made, certain officials are ineligible for bonuses. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress listing facilities with certifications. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress listing VA medical facilities that have certified compliance with regulations and those that have not, including reports submitted under subsection (b). The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to uniformly apply the directives and policies of the Department to all offices and facilities. If there is a deviation from this uniform application, the Secretary must notify the Committees on Veterans' Affairs in Congress. Additionally, certain officials of the Department of Veterans Affairs must be appointed and confirmed. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must ensure uniform application of directives and policies across all offices and facilities. Certain officials, including the Principal Deputy Under Secretary for Health, are appointed by the President with Senate approval. Other Deputy Under Secretary positions are appointed based on recommendations from the Under Secretary for Health. The President appoints the Deputy Under Secretary for Field Operations of the Department with Senate approval. No new positions can be created within the Department of Veterans Affairs. These rules apply to appointments made after the enactment of this Act.
